column1: This course is designed to introduce students to the concepts and skills essential for pursuing a career in advertising media. Students will learn the planning, selection, and evaluation of advertising media for possible use in advertising campaigns and discuss trends and challenges in current media environment. Fundamental media planning concepts such as reach, frequency, ratings, share, gross rating points, and other cost and audience measurement factors will be discussed in the context of traditional print, broadcast, out-of-home media as well as digital and alternative media options. Students will also become familiar with using syndicated data for developing a media plan.
